info.name: EBANX APIs
info.description:
This is a postman collection to help you to quickly integrate with EBANX. Any problems or suggestions? Please send us an email.

You can also check our full API reference at https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference

item.name: Payouts

request.description:
This method allows you to **create** a payout.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Payout/paths/~1ws~1payout~1create/post)

Within this end-point you will be able to **cancel a payout** using payouts's ``external_reference`` or its ``uid``   

The payout has to be in a status equal to OP and within the cancellation time.

Please, notice that if you try to use both ``uid`` and  ``external_reference`` in thhe same request, we will take in account ``uid`` and **ignore** ``external_reference``.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Payout/paths/~1ws~1payout~1cancel/post)

This method allows you to **commit a payout**, starting the payment process, without having to wait the cancellation time. The payout has to be in a status equal to OP and within the cancellation time.

You have to send either the ``external_reference`` or the ``uid``.

Please, notice that if you try to use both ``uid`` and  ``external_reference`` in thhe same request, we will take in account ``uid`` and **ignore** ``external_reference``.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Payout/paths/~1ws~1payout~1commit/post)

This method allows you to **search** multiple payouts information.

You have to include a range of dates in ``date_from`` and ``date_to``

You can also use ``status`` to filter status of your payoit requests. Pagination is also available to this API.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Payout/paths/~1ws~1payout~1search/post)

This method allows you to **simulate** a payout.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Payout/paths/~1ws~1payout~1simulate/post)

This method allows you to **retrieve** a payout.

You have to send either the ``external_reference`` or the ``uid``.

Please, notice that if you try to use both ``uid`` and  ``external_reference`` in thhe same request, we will take in account ``uid`` and **ignore** ``external_reference``.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Payout/paths/~1ws~1payout~1retrieve/post)

This method allows you to **attach** a PDF File to a payout. In order to attach the file, a Payout must be previously created with the method Create. The `invoice` must be a PDF file.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Payout/paths/~1ws~1payout~1attach/post)

item.description:
![EBANX logo][logo]

[logo]: https://mrcsvg.github.io/EBANX-api-reference/assets/ebanx-logo-vector.svg

Here you can find all the APIs you need to create and manage a Payout with EBANX.

item.name: Transfer

request.description:
This method allows you to **create a transfer** request.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Transfer/paths/~1ws~1transfer~1create/post)

This method allows you to **cancel a transfer** request. You have to send either the transfer_code, uid, settlement_code or external_reference.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Transfer/paths/~1ws~1transfer~1cancel/post)

This method allows you to **commit a transfer**, confirming the transfer without having to wait the cancellation time. The transfer must be a payment balance transfer and have the status equal to ``OP`` and within the cancellation time.

You have to send either the transfer_code, uid, settlement_code or external_reference.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Transfer/paths/~1ws~1transfer~1commit/post)

This method allows you to **retrieve a transfer** information. You have to send either the transfer_code, uid, settlement_code or external_reference.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Transfer/paths/~1ws~1transfer~1retrieve/post)

This method allows you to **search multiple transfers** information.

Please, refer to our API Reference to check the available options at this  [link](https://ebanx.github.io/api-reference/#tag/Transfer/paths/~1ws~1transfer~1search/post)

item.description: Here you can find all the APIs you need to transfer your balance in order to use a Payout.

item.name: Utils

request.description: This method allows you to get your *available balance*.
This method call will return a JSON object with all the available bank details information per country.
The bank operation method call will return a JSON object with the all the available banks per country.

item.description: Here you can find all the APIs you need to get additional information in order to manage your Payout operations.
